creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: Set sterling silver with New Zealand jade finials and black fiber handles
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist%2C artist%27s estate%2C or assignees
medium: Silver, New Zealand jade, synthetic fiber
text: While clearly indebted to French Art Deco silverwork, this <I>pièce de résistance<I> was designed to "outshine" the French in their own specialty. Its sleek streamlining is mainline American, but even more avant-garde is the black synthetic fiber inset in the handles--a daring statement when combined with a precious metal such as silver. Attributed to Barney, a principal designer at Tiffany & Co., the service was designed for and first displayed in the House of Jewels Pavilion in the 1939 New York World's Fair.
title: Tray from the "Tête à Tête" tea and coffee set
